text.p: Headlines from major national newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
EL PAIS
- Garzon accuses chief of Cesid for failing to give him names of five agents
- Mourning in Guatemala for the death of 79 fans
- Yeltsin throws Lebed out of Kremlin for excessive ambition
EL MUNDO
- Lebed asks for calm from army after being dismissed by weakened Yeltsin
- Avalanche of death
DIARIO 16
- "I negotiated with ETA in the name of the PSOE government"
ABC
- The underlying ETA plan for regouping prisoners becomes clear
LA VANGUARDIA
- Garzon accuses Cesid director who named Aznar
- Maragall launches idea of Expo 2004 for Barcelona
CINCO DIAS
- PP-PSOE pact on telecoms
- Construction groups exchange worker seniority for 14 billion
- Popular rises five percent in trade and earnings
- Valencia saves four billion with generic medicines for prescriptions
EXPANSION
- European Commission investigates Spain's 1997 budget plan
- Aznar calls on four ex-ministers to analyse economic situation
- Santander creates Spanish holding to group foreign banking jewels
GACETA DE LOS NEGOCIOS
- Gasoline breaks barrier of 120 pesetas a litre
- Mortgage loans are 2.5 points cheaper than a year ago
- Banco Popular results rise 5.8 percent
- Monica Ridruejo proposes fee to finance RTVE
